channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pardoned Capitol rioter arrested for allegedly threatening to kill Hakeem Jeffries
item.description: New York State Police say the man was arrested after they received word from the FBI that that he made "threats to kill a member of Congress."

item.title: Israel takes steps to shut down international aid groups in Gaza and the West Bank
item.description: Israel is de-registering major nongovernmental aid groups from helping people in the Palestinian territories, according to several officials with huma...

item.title: 5 things to know about Sanae Takaichi, Japan's first female prime minister
item.description: Japan ranks low in gender equality among developed nations. The first woman to lead the country is an ultraconservative who cites Margaret Thatcher as...

item.title: Reversing peanut advice prevented tens of thousands of allergy cases, researchers say
item.description: A decade ago, research said giving young children peanut products can prevent allergies. A new study says that, 10 years later, tens of thousands of U...

item.title: Books about race and gender to be returned to school libraries on some military bases
item.description: The order is to be implemented at school libraries on military bases in Kentucky, Virginia, Italy and Japan. Students and their families claimed their...

item.title: Senate GOP meets with Trump at White House on Day 21 of shutdown
item.description: At a lunch with GOP senators at the White House, President Trump stood firm in his demands that Democrats vote to end the government shutdown. Follow ...

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil appears in appeals court as Trump administration continues efforts to deport him
Colombian court overturns former president's conviction
item.description: Alvaro Uribe was the country's first president to be criminally convicted, and faced 12 years' house arrest.

item.title: Vance: Israel-Hamas ceasefire "going frankly better than I expected"
item.description: Vice President JD Vance urged "patience" as Israel waits for the return of all the hostages' remains from Hamas.

item.title: 60% of workers are unhappy with key aspects of their job, survey finds
item.description: Six in 10 employees say their jobs are falling short on issues including pay, scheduling and career advancement, a new analysis finds.

item.title: Ukrainian city in total blackout after 'massive' Russian assault
item.description: Across the wider region, four people are reported to have been killed and 10 others injured.

item.title: Redrawn GOP congressional map in North Carolina on brink of approval
item.description: The proposed map targets a closely- divided House district currently held by a Democrat.

item.title: Watch: Dozens of giant pumpkins hit the water for rowing race
item.description: The 'squashbucklers' climbed into their hollowed out giant gourds, which are grown locally in the US state of Oregon.

item.title: Stolen Louvre jewellery worth â‚¬88m, prosecutor says
item.description: The historic items were taken in broad daylight and are now feared to have been broken down for parts.

item.title: Democrats look to long term as North Carolina GOP redistricting plan seeks another seat for Trump

item.title: Israel receives two bodies Hamas says are dead hostages
item.description: Two coffins were handed over by Hamas to the Israeli military via the Red Cross in Gaza on Tuesday.

item.title: Jack Smith's attorneys defend special counsel's analyzing GOP lawmakers' phone data

item.title: In Chicago, an immense show of force signals a sharp escalation in White House immigration crackdown
